data.title: Carcharodontogenius's Wishlist for JWE2
data.meta_description:
This is my personal wishlist & I would like to share it with you guys.

Mesozoic Land Creatures

Gorgosaurus.
Epidexipteryx.
Sauroposeidon.
Riojasaurus...
data.text:
I am having doubts about Othneilia despite its debut in the original novel version of Jurassic Park.

Deinosuchus and Microceratus will do for all eras.

Tarbosaurus, Rhamphorhynchus, and Archaeopteryx will be ideal additions to the Jurassic World era.

I am having doubts about Othnielia despite its debut in the original novel version of Jurassic Park.

Deinosuchus and Microceratus will do for all eras.

Tarbosaurus, Rhamphorhynchus, and Archaeopteryx will be ideal additions to the Jurassic World era.

OK.

@VSSEMike, why just Jurassic World for Tarbosaurus?

There are no records of Tarbosaurus being planned to be added to Jurassic Park.

There are more dinosaur species in the Jurassic World era than the Jurassic Park era.

In the Jurassic Park era, "humans and dinosaurs are not meant to be close to one another". It is what Dr. Malcolm said in the intro of the third level of Chaos Theory.

The concept of Jurassic World is on the possibility of humans and dinosaurs coexisting in one another. Dr. Malcolm made such prediction at the end of the film Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom and Charlotte Lockwood said so in a recording in Jurassic World: Dominion.
